analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is broadly bullish (70-100% across sources) with moderate-to-high conviction, but bullish positioning appears technologically-driven rather than catalyst-driven. Bearish voices cite concrete technical exhaustion in commodities/crypto and earnings guidance cuts, creating tension between headline momentum and underlying breadth deterioration.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Rate policy expectations and monetary easing tailwinds supporting risk appetite; (2) AI productivity narratives and tech sector mean reversion competing with guidance cuts across enterprise software and financials; (3) Technical exhaustion in commodities and cryptocurrency with potential mean reversion; (4) Bifurcated market performance between AI-adjacent sectors and rate-sensitive cyclicals.

Near support: $670 (45k OI, active), $645 (126k OI, dormant). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI â€“ active hedging, 1.0% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI â€“ dormant, 5.4% away). Max Pain $621. key_themes: Rate policy expectations and monetary easing support
AI productivity momentum vs. earnings guidance cuts
Technical exhaustion in commodities and cryptocurrency
Bifurcated sector performance: tech outperformance, financials/cyclicals underperformance
Momentum breadth deterioration beneath headline strength
risk_factors: Silver technical exhaustion (exhaustion gap, 7/9 consecutive up days, 87% above 200-day MA) may trigger mean reversion pullback
Cryptocurrency resistance at elevated levels with potential for liquidation cascade if support breaks
Guidance cuts cascading across enterprise software and fintech sectors suggest demand destruction risk beneath surface
Equity momentum breadth contraction (116 positive signals vs. historical 150+) indicates weakening bull case sustainability
Regulatory tightening on financial institutions and supervisory actions may extend sector rotation pressure
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Resistance at $700 Call Wall (active hedging zone); support at $670 (active support level, 2.9% below). QQQ: Resistance at $630 Call Wall and $625 level (both active); support at $590 Put Wall (dormant until approached). Watch for consolidation near Call Walls with dealer hedging activity capping upside momentum.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Put Wall at $640 (7.3% below) represents major support floor for 1-5 day pullbacks; Call Wall at $700 is active resistance but likely breached on continued bullish momentum. QQQ: Put Wall at $590 (5.4% below) is swing support; $640 resistance with 31k OI is active. Max Pain gravitation ($686 SPY, $621 QQQ) suggests underlying support into week-end expiration. Potential swing range: SPY $670-$700, QQQ $625-$640.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
